Name: Requiring DOE to report actual class sizes and expand reports on the amount of students in special programs in New York city public schools.
Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter and the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the New York city department of education to report actual class sizes and expand reports on the amount of students in special programs in New York city public schools

History.Description: This Introduction was Introduced by Council
This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Education

Summary: This bill would require the Department of Education (DOE) to report the actual class size of all classes in DOE schools and programs. This bill would also require the DOE to report on a district, borough, and citywide level, the number and percentage of students in special programs, disaggregated by program type, grade, race or ethnicity, gender, and English language learner status.

\pard\cbpat3\ltrpar\fi720\sl480\slmult1\qj Section 1.\cf1  Subdivision c of section 522 of the New York city charter, as added by local law number 125 for the year 2005, is amended to read as follows:\par
c. Class size reporting. The department of education shall submit a report \ul on class sizes\ulnone  to the city council twice annually, on or before November [fifteenth] \ul 15\ulnone  and February [fifteenth] \ul 15\ulnone  of each year[, with respect to]\ul . Each November 15 report shall reflect class sizes as of the next preceding October 31, and each February 15 report shall reflect class sizes as of the next preceding February 1. Such reports shall include\ulnone  the following information regarding class sizes in New York city public schools:\par
1. For each school and, separately, for each academic program within a school or school building, including smaller schools housed within larger institutions and specialized programs, such as those for gifted students and for students with special needs, the average class size per grade of all classes \ul and the actual class size of each class\ulnone  in such school or program; \ul\par
\pard\cbpat3\ltrpar\fi720\sl480\slmult1\qj\tx1440\ulnone 2. For each school district and for each region, the average class size per grade of all classes in such district and region; \ul\par
\ulnone 3. For each borough, the average class size per grade of all classes in such borough; \ul\par
\pard\cbpat3\ltrpar\fi720\sl480\slmult1\qj\ulnone 4. Citywide, the average class size per grade; and\par
5. A detailed description of the methodologies used to calculate all such grade size data reported.\par
\'a7 2. Section 21-957 of the administrative code of the city of New York, as amended by local law number 223 for the year 2019, is amended to read as follows:\par
\'a7 21-957 Annual report on the demographics of students in grades kindergarten through [eight] \ul 8\ulnone . Not later than December 31, 2015, and by December 1 of each year thereafter, the department shall submit to the speaker of the council and post on its website a report regarding the following:\par
a. For each community school district, school within such district, special program within such school, and grade within such school, the total number of [public school] students enrolled in the preceding school year in grades kindergarten through [eight] \ul 8\ulnone  and the number and percentage of such students who:\par
1. Receive special education services;\par
2. Are English language learners;\par
3. Are eligible for the federal free or reduced price meals program;\par
4. Reside in temporary housing;\par
5. Are attending school out of the attendance zone in which the student resides; and\par
6. Are attending school out of the community school district in which the student resides.\par
b. The data provided pursuant to subdivision a shall be disaggregated by:\par
1. Grade level; \par
2. Race or ethnicity;\par
3. Gender;\par
4. English language learner status; and\par
5. Primary home language.\par
\ul c. For each community school district, each borough, and citywide, the number and percentage of students enrolled in special programs \cf2 in the preceding school year in grades kindergarten through 8.\ulnone\par
\ul d. The data provided pursuant to subdivision c shall be disaggregated by:\par
\cf1 1. Program type;\par
2. Grade;\par
3. Race or ethnicity;\par
4. Gender;\par
5. Special education status; and\par
6. English language learner status.\ulnone\par
[c.] \ul e.\ulnone  For students in grades [three] \ul 3\ulnone  through [eight] \ul 8\ulnone , the data provided pursuant to subdivision a of this section shall indicate:\par
1. The number of students who completed the New York state mathematics examination, disaggregated by performance level; and\par
2. The number of students who completed the New York state English language arts examination, disaggregated by performance level. \par
[d.] \ul f.\ulnone  For each school and special program set forth in subdivision a of this section, the department shall report:\par
1. The admissions process used by such school or special program, including but not limited to, whether admission to such school or special program is based on a lottery; a geographic zone; an audition; a screening of candidates for such school; including a detailed description of such screening; or a standardized test;\par
2. Any criteria or methods that are used to supplement the admissions process, including but not limited to, preferences established under the department's diversity in admissions pilot, composite score formulas, waitlists or a principal's discretion;\par
3. A side-by-side comparison of the racial and ethnic demographics of such school or special program with the racial and ethnic demographics of all students in grades kindergarten through [eight] \ul 8\ulnone  that reside within the applicable attendance zone, and, if the applicable attendance zone is smaller than the community school district, a side-by-side comparison of the racial and ethnic demographics of the school or special program, the applicable attendance zone\ul ,\ulnone  and the applicable community school district; and\par
4. Whether such school or special program is becoming more or less similar to the racial and ethnic demographics of the applicable attendance zone and the community school district, based on the comparison required pursuant to paragraph 3 of this subdivision.\par
[e.] \ul g.\ulnone  For each community school district, the department shall report on whether the department made any efforts in such community school district during the preceding school year to encourage a diverse student body in its schools and special programs and, if so, the details of such efforts, including, but not limited to, strategic site selection of new schools and special programs, making recommendations to the community education council to draw attendance zones with recognition of the demographics of neighborhoods, the allocation of resources for schools and special programs, and targeted outreach and recruitment efforts.\par
[f.] \ul h.\ulnone  No information that is otherwise required to be reported pursuant to this section shall be reported in a manner that would violate any applicable provision of federal, state\ul ,\ulnone  or local law relating to the privacy of student information or that would interfere with law enforcement investigations or otherwise conflict with the interests of law enforcement. If a category contains between [one] \ul 1\ulnone  and [five] \ul 5\ulnone  students, or contains an amount that would allow another category that contains between [one] \ul 1\ulnone  and [five] \ul 5\ulnone  students to be deduced, the number shall be replaced with a symbol. A category that contains [zero] \ul 0\ulnone  shall be reported as [zero] \ul 0\ulnone , unless such reporting would violate any applicable provision of federal, state\ul ,\ulnone  or local law relating to the privacy of student information.\par
[g.] \ul i.\ulnone  The report required pursuant to this section shall, to the extent the department has such information, include data regarding charter schools located within the [five] \ul 5\ulnone  boroughs.\par
\'a7 3. This local law shall take effect immediately.\par
